html: (2 Nephi 7:4)."The tongue of the learned." God gives the Servant the power of the learned: He is knowledgeable and fluent in expression, and He shall not be confounded. Perhaps more importantly, He knows how to speak to Israel, whether to comfort her or to appropriately rebuke her. A similar promise is given by Jesus to His disciples. (Luke 21:12-15.) Monte Nyman suggests that "verse 4 also fits the calling and mission of Joseph Smith and the elders of restored Israel, who were to cause the wisdom of the wise men to perish (see Isaiah 29:14)." (GAWI, 192.) Victor Ludlow cautions, "we should not limit these references to the life of Christ, but should try to apply them to many of God's chosen servants." (IPSP, 422.)
